definition: to get promoted (at work etc)/promotion
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
office/duty

sentences.english: This system encourages not only internal promotions but lateral moves as well.
sentences.chinese: 该系统不仅鼓励内部升职也支持平职调换。

sentences.english: I hope that I can get a job which guaranties chances for advancement.
sentences.chinese: 我希望有一个提供升职机会的工作。

sentences.english: Maybe at work, you received a promotion offer.
sentences.chinese: 比如，在工作中，你收到了一个升职的通知书。

sentences.english: He is biding his time for a promotion.
sentences.chinese: 他正在等待升职的有利时机。

sentences.english: I hope to get a job with opportunity of promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我希望有一个提供升职机会的工作。

sentences.english: Jessica was transferred from the warehouse to the accounting office, which was considered a promotion.
sentences.chinese: 杰西卡从仓库调到了会计室，想来应该算是一种升职。

sentences.english: Gillard's Apricot Kernels will be short-lived, with Rudd due to return to Artificial Turf late Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 但吉拉德的升职只是短暂的，陆克文周四晚就会回国。

sentences.english: Please accept my congratulations on your recent promotion.
sentences.chinese: 请接受我对于你最近升职的贺喜。

sentences.english: Money mother Xu fei resign, great promotion for governor separated.
sentences.chinese: 许飞辞去职务分开，多多升职为总监。

sentences.english: I'm wondering isf he would be promoted.
sentences.chinese: 我怀疑他是否能得到升职。

sentences.english: The organization uses performance as the basis for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 组织将员工表现作为升职的基础条件。

sentences.english: Promotions and demotions were zealously monitored.
sentences.chinese: 受疯狂监视的升职和降职。

sentences.english: Compensation and promotions are based solely on achievement of short-term performance targets.
sentences.chinese: 补偿和升职仅仅是基于短期表现的成绩。

sentences.english: As the white-haired boy, she got her promotion as expected soon.
sentences.chinese: 作为大红人，如预期一样，她很快就升职了。

sentences.english: Gillard"s elevation will be short-lived, with Rudd due to return to Australia late Thursday."
sentences.chinese: 但吉拉德的升职只是短暂的，陆克文周四晚就会回国。

sentences.english: Li Ke, the author of Du Lala's Promotion, has been stressing the  significance of her fiction.
sentences.chinese: 《杜拉拉升职记》的作者李可强调了这本书的重要性。

definition: promote/promotion
to get promoted
to raise salary
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to promote to a higher position
boss/superior
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to receive a raise in salary
to demote (to a lower rank)
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
post/office/position
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
to change jobs/job-hopping
to transfer to full membership/to obtain tenure
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
